commitMessage:
docs: add enforcement metadata headers for standards clarity (HODGE-283)

## What Changed
- Enhanced .hodge/standards.md with enforcement metadata headers for each section
- Added Quick Reference table showing enforcement by phase (Explore/Build/Harden/Ship)
- Created Standards Enforcement Guide in .hodge/principles.md (25 lines added)
- Updated standards-enforcement.smoke.test.ts with comprehensive validation tests
- Modified 10 files with 181 insertions and 34 deletions

## Why This Change
AI assistants needed clearer guidance on when standards apply during each
development phase. The previous "THESE STANDARDS ARE MANDATORY" declaration
was ambiguous - it wasn't clear which standards were suggestions in explore
mode versus blocking requirements in ship mode.

## Impact
- AI assistants can now precisely identify enforcement levels per phase
- Progressive enforcement is explicit: Build(suggested) → Harden(required) → Ship(mandatory)
- Backward compatible - no breaking changes to existing workflow
- Improved developer experience with at-a-glance enforcement table
- Enhanced test coverage validates enforcement metadata is parseable

## Technical Details
- Section headers use format: **Enforcement: Build(suggested) → Harden(required) → Ship(mandatory)**
- Critical standards marked with: **Enforcement: ALL PHASES (mandatory)**
- Added 7 new smoke tests to verify metadata presence and parseability
- Standards Enforcement Guide explains notation for both humans and AI

Closes HODGE-283
